title: Caroline Abbé
text:
Caroline Agnès Abbé (born 13 January 1988) is a <a href="Switzerland">Swiss</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a>. She currently plays for <a href="Servette%20FC%20Ch%C3%AAnois%20F%C3%A9minin">Servette Chênois</a>, and for the <a href="Switzerland%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Switzerland women's national football team</a> as their <a href="Captain%20%28association%20football%29">captain</a>.
Career.
Abbé is a former player of <a href="FC%20Yverdon%20F%C3%A9minin">FC Yverdon</a>, with whom she won two <a href="Swiss%20Women%27s%20Cup">National Cups</a>. In the <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20Fu%C3%9Fball-Bundesliga%20%28women%29">2011–12 Bundesliga</a> summer transfer market, she signed for newly promoted <a href="SC%20Freiburg%20%28women%29">SC Freiburg</a>.
In 2014, she signed for <a href="FC%20Bayern%20Munich%20%28women%29">Bayern Munich</a> to play there until 2017. In June 2017, she returned to Switzerland to play for <a href="FC%20Z%C3%BCrich%20Frauen">FC Zürich</a>.
FOOTBALL CAREER TRANSFERS AND STATISTICS.
We are going to show you the list of football clubs and seasons in which Caroline Abbé has played. It includes the total number of appearance (caps), substitution details, goals, yellow and red cards stats.
